summary.span: 表示一个时间间隔。

span.span: Represents a time interval.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个 对象表示时间间隔（时间间隔或运行时间），其测量方式为正值、小时、分钟、秒和秒的小数部分。A object represents a time interval (duration of time or elapsed time) that is measured as a positive or negative number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and fractions of a second. 结构还可以用于表示一天中的时间，但前提是该时间与特定日期无关。The structure can also be used to represent the time of day, but only if the time is unrelated to a particular date. 否则，应改为使用 或 结构。Otherwise, the or structure should be used instead. （有关使用 结构来反映当天的时间的详细信息，请参阅[在 DateTime、DateTimeOffset、TimeSpan 和 TimeZoneInfo 之间进行选择](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md)。）(For more information about using the structure to reflect the time of day, see [Choosing Between DateTime, DateTimeOffset, TimeSpan, and TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md).) > [!NOTE] > 值表示时间间隔，可表示为特定的天数、小时数、分钟数、秒数和毫秒数。A value represents a time interval and can be expressed as a particular number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds. 因为它表示不引用特定开始点或结束点的常规间隔，所以不能用年份和月份来表示，这两种间隔的天数都是可变的。Because it represents a general interval without reference to a particular start or end point, it cannot be expressed in terms of years and months, both of which have a variable number of days. 它与 值不同，后者表示不引用特定时区的日期和时间，或表示特定时间段的 值。It differs from a value, which represents a date and time without reference to a particular time zone, or a value, which represents a specific moment of time. 结构用来度量持续时间的最大时间单位是一天。The largest unit of time that the structure uses to measure duration is a day. 时间间隔以天为单位进行一致性度量，因为较大的时间单位（如月份和年份）的天数会变化。Time intervals are measured in days for consistency, because the number of days in larger units of time, such as months and years, varies. 对象的值是与所表示的时间间隔相等的计时周期数。The value of a object is the number of ticks that equal the represented time interval. 勾选标记等于100毫微秒，即 1 10-秒秒。A tick is equal to 100 nanoseconds, or one ten-millionth of a second. 对象的值的范围可以是 。The value of a object can range from to . ## 实例化 TimeSpan 值Instantiating a TimeSpan Value 可以通过多种方式实例化 值：You can instantiate a value in a number of ways: - 通过调用其隐式无参数构造函数。By calling its implicit parameterless constructor. 这会创建一个对象，其值为 ，如下面的示例所示。This creates an object whose value is , as the following example shows. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#2)] - 通过调用其显式构造函数之一。By calling one of its explicit constructors. 下面的示例将 值初始化为指定的小时数、分钟数和秒数。The following example initializes a value to a specified number of hours, minutes, and seconds. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#3)] - 通过调用方法或执行返回 值的操作。By calling a method or performing an operation that returns a value. 例如，可以实例化一个表示两个日期和时间值之间的间隔的 值，如下例所示。For example, you can instantiate a value that represents the interval between two date and time values, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#4)] 您还可以通过这种方式将 对象初始化为零时间值，如下面的示例所示。You can also initialize a object to a zero time value in this way, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/zero1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/zero1.vb#6)] 值由 、和 结构的算术运算符和方法返回。 values are returned by arithmetic operators and methods of the , , and structures. - 通过分析 值的字符串表示形式。By parsing the string representation of a value. 您可以使用 和 方法将包含时间间隔的字符串转换为 值。You can use the and methods to convert strings that contain time intervals to values. 下面的示例使用 方法将字符串数组转换为 值。The following example uses the method to convert an array of strings to values. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#5)] 此外，还可以通过调用 或 方法，定义要分析并转换为 值的输入字符串的精确格式。In addition, you can define the precise format of the input string to be parsed and converted to a value by calling the or method. ## 对 TimeSpan 值执行操作Performing Operations on TimeSpan Values 您可以通过使用 和 运算符或通过调用 和 方法来增加和减少持续时间。You can add and subtract time durations either by using the and operators, or by calling the and methods. 还可以通过调用 、和 方法来比较两个持续时间。You can also compare two time durations by calling the , , and methods. 结构还包括 和 方法，将时间间隔转换为正值和负值，The structure also includes the and methods, which convert time intervals to positive and negative values, 值的范围将 。The range of values is to . ## 设置 TimeSpan 值的格式Formatting a TimeSpan Value 值可以表示为 [*-*]*d*。*hh*：*mm*：*ss*。*ff*，其中可选的负号指示负时间间隔， *d*组件是天， *hh*是小时，以24小时制度量， *mm*为分钟， *ss*表示秒，而*ff*表示为秒的小数部分。A value can be represented as [*-*]*d*.*hh*:*mm*:*ss*.*ff*, where the optional minus sign indicates a negative time interval, the *d* component is days, *hh* is hours as measured on a 24-hour clock, *mm* is minutes, *ss* is seconds, and *ff* is fractions of a second. 也就是说，时间间隔由正数或负数，而不是一天中的某个时间或一天中的某个时间或一天中的某个时间。That is, a time interval consists of a positive or negative number of days without a time of day, or a number of days with a time of day, or only a time of day. 从 [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]开始， 结构通过其 方法的重载支持区分区域性的格式设置，这会将 值转换为其字符串表示形式。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the structure supports culture-sensitive formatting through the overloads of its method, which converts a value to its string representation. 默认 方法通过使用与先前版本的 .NET Framework 中的返回值相同的固定格式返回时间间隔。The default method returns a time interval by using an invariant format that is identical to its return value in previous versions of the .NET Framework. 重载允许您指定定义时间间隔的字符串表示形式的格式字符串。The overload lets you specify a format string that defines the string representation of the time interval. 重载使你可以指定格式字符串和用于创建时间间隔的字符串表示形式的格式设置约定的区域性。The overload lets you specify a format string and the culture whose formatting conventions are used to create the string representation of the time interval. 支持标准和自定义格式字符串。 supports both standard and custom format strings. （有关详细信息，请参阅[标准 Timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义的 timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。）但是，只有标准格式字符串区分区域性。(For more information, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md).) However, only standard format strings are culture-sensitive. ## 还原旧的 TimeSpan 格式Restoring Legacy TimeSpan Formatting 在某些情况下，[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]不会在 [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] 和更早版本中成功设置 值格式的代码。In some cases, code that successfully formats values in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions fails in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. 这在调用[< TimeSpan_LegacyFormatMode > 元素](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md)方法以便使用格式字符串设置 值格式的代码中最常见。This is most common in code that calls a [ element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md) method to format a value with a format string. 下面的示例成功设置了 [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] 和更早版本中 值的格式，但在 [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] 和更高版本中引发了异常。The following example successfully formats a value in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions, but throws an exception in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] and later versions. 请注意，它尝试使用不受支持的格式说明符（在 [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] 及更早版本中被忽略）来设置 值的格式。Note that it attempts to format a value by using an unsupported format specifier, which is ignored in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.Class.Legacy#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.legacy/cs/legacycode1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.Legacy#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.legacy/vb/legacycode1.vb#1)] 如果无法修改代码，可以通过以下方式之一还原 值的旧格式设置：If you cannot modify the code, you can restore the legacy formatting of values in one of the following ways: - 通过创建包含[> 元素 < TimeSpan_LegacyFormatMode](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md)的配置文件。By creating a configuration file that contains the [ element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md). 将此元素的 `enabled` 属性设置为 `true` 会按应用程序还原旧 格式。Setting this element's `enabled` attribute to `true` restores legacy formatting on a per-application basis. - 在创建应用程序域时设置 "NetFx40_TimeSpanLegacyFormatMode" 兼容性开关。By setting the "NetFx40_TimeSpanLegacyFormatMode" compatibility switch when you create an application domain. 这将在每个应用程序域的基础上启用旧 格式设置。This enables legacy formatting on a per-application-domain basis. 下面的示例创建一个使用旧 格式的应用程序域。The following example creates an application domain that uses legacy formatting. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/cs/perappdomain1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/vb/perappdomain1.vb#1)] 当在新应用程序域中执行以下代码时，它将恢复为旧 格式设置行为。When the following code executes in the new application domain, it reverts to legacy formatting behavior. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/cs/showtimespan.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/vb/showtimespan.vb#2)] ## Examples 下面的示例实例化一个表示两个日期之间的差异的 对象。The following example instantiates a object that represents the difference between two dates. 然后，它显示 对象的属性。It then displays the object's properties. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/structure1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/structure1.vb#1)] [!code-powershell[System.TimeSpan.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/powershell/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/ps/structure1.ps1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值可以表示为 [*-*]*d*。*hh*：*mm*：*ss*。*ff*，其中可选的负号指示负时间间隔， *d*组件是天， *hh*是小时，以24小时制度量， *mm*为分钟， *ss*表示秒，而*ff*表示为秒的小数部分。A value can be represented as [*-*]*d*.*hh*:*mm*:*ss*.*ff*, where the optional minus sign indicates a negative time interval, the *d* component is days, *hh* is hours as measured on a 24-hour clock, *mm* is minutes, *ss* is seconds, and *ff* is fractions of a second. 属性的值是日分量， *d*。The value of the property is the day component, *d*. 属性表示整天，而 属性表示整天和小数部分。The property represents whole days, whereas the property represents whole and fractional days. ## Examples 下面的示例创建多个 对象，并显示每个对象的 属性。The following example creates several objects and displays the property of each. param.name: s
param.span: 一个字符串，用于指定进行转换的时间间隔。

summary.span: 将时间间隔的字符串表示形式转换为等效的 。

span.span: Converts the string representation of a time interval to its equivalent.

returns.span: 与 对应的时间间隔。

span.span: A time interval that corresponds to .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `s` 参数包含如下格式的时间间隔规范：The `s` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*][-]{ *d* | [*d.*]*hh*：*mm*[：*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | [*d*.]*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 需要使用括在大括号（{和}）中的替代项列表进行一项选择，|并用竖线（）分隔。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|说明Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选空白。Optional white space.| |-|可选的负号，指示负 。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|天，范围介于0到10675199之间。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |..|一种区分区域性的符号，用于将天与小时隔开。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 固定格式使用句点（"."）字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|小时，范围为0到23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |：:|区分区域性的时间分隔符。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 固定格式使用冒号（"："）字符。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分钟，范围为0到59。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|可选秒，范围介于0到59之间。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*。**.*|区分区域性的符号，将秒与秒的小数部分分隔开来。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 固定格式使用句点（"."）字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|可选的秒的小数部分，由1到7个十进制数字组成。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 如果 `s` 参数不是日期值，则它必须包含小时和分钟部分;其他组件是可选的。If the `s` argument is not a day value only, it must include an hours and a minutes component; other components are optional. 如果它们存在，则每个时间组件的值必须在指定的范围内。If they are present, the values of each time component must fall within a specified range. 例如， *hh*，小时部分的值必须介于0到23之间。For example, the value of *hh*, the hours component, must be between 0 and 23. 因此，将 "23:00:00" 传递到 方法将返回时间间隔23小时。Because of this, passing "23:00:00" to the method returns a time interval of 23 hours. 另一方面，传递 "24:00:00" 将返回24天的时间间隔。On the other hand, passing "24:00:00" returns a time interval of 24 days. 由于 "24" 超出了时间部分的范围，因此它被解释为天数部分。Because "24" is outside the range of the hours component, it is interpreted as the days component. `s` 的组件必须共同指定一个大于或等于 且小于或等于 的时间间隔。The components of `s` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法尝试使用当前区域性的每个特定于区域性的格式来分析 `s`。The method tries to parse `s` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the current culture. ## 调用方说明Notes to callers 当要分析的字符串中的时间间隔组件包含的位数超过7个时，.NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本中的分析操作可能与 .NET Framework 4 和更高版本中的分析操作的行为不同。When a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may behave differently from parsing operations in the .NET Framework 4 and later versions. 在某些情况下，在 .NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本中成功的分析操作可能会失败，并在 .NET Framework 4 和更高版本中引发 。In some cases, parsing operations that succeed in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the .NET Framework 4 and later. 在其他情况下，在 .NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本中引发 的分析操作可能会失败，并引发 .NET Framework 4 及更高版本中的 。In other cases, parsing operations that throw a in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the .NET Framework 4 and later. 下面的示例演示了这两种方案。The following example illustrates both scenarios. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/cs/parsefailure1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/vb/parsefailure1.vb#3)] ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法将字符串数组中的每个元素转换为 值。The following example uses the method to convert each element in a string array to a value. 它将当前系统区域性更改为克罗地亚语（"hr"）和英语美国（"en-us"）来说明当前系统区域性如何影响分析操作。It changes the current system culture to Croatian - Croatia ("hr-HR") and English - United States ("en-US") to illustrate how the current system culture affects the parsing operation. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/cs/parse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/vb/parse1.vb#1)]

`formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## 调用方说明Notes to callers 当要分析的字符串中的时间间隔组件包含的位数超过7个时，.NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本中的分析操作可能与 .NET Framework 4 from parsing operations in the .NET Framework 4 and later versions. 在某些情况下，在 .NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本中成功的分析操作可能会失败，并在 .NET Framework 4 和更高版本中引发 。In some cases, parsing operations that succeed in the operations that throw a in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the .NET Framework 4 and later. 下面的示例演示了这两种方案。The following example illustrates both scenarios. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔的字符串表示形式，该时间间隔必须采用 `format` 参数定义的格式，但会忽略前导和尾随空白字符。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 由于 `input` 必须严格符合 `format` 的格式，因此，在将用户的字符串输入转换为时间间隔时，应始终使用异常处理。Because `input` must conform to the format of `format` exactly, you should always use exception handling when converting a string input by the user to a time interval. 如果不想使用异常处理，可以改为调用 方法。If you prefer not to use exception handling, you can call the method instead. `format` 参数是包含单个标准格式说明符的字符串，或一个或多个定义所需的 `input`格式的自定义格式说明符。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 Timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义的 timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). > [!IMPORTANT] > 仅当 `format` 是标准的 格式字符串（其值为 "g" 或 "G"）时， 方法才使用 `formatProvider` 参数指定的区域性约定。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if `format` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t" 和 "T" 标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义输入字符串的精确格式，并使用原义字符分隔时间间隔的组成部分。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider` 参数是一个 实现，如果 `format` 是标准格式字符串，则它提供有关返回字符串格式的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下任一项：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示要在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 属性返回的 对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个 对象，该对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现 接口的自定义对象。A custom object that implements the interface. 它的 方法返回提供格式设置信息的 对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果 `null``formatProvider`，则使用与当前区域性关联的 对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法，使用各种格式字符串和区域性分析时间间隔的几个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔的字符串表示形式，该时间间隔必须采用 `formats` 参数定义的格式之一，但会忽略前导和尾随空白字符。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in one of the formats defined by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 由于 `input` 必须严格符合 `formats`中指定的格式之一，因此，在将用户的字符串输入转换为时间间隔时，应始终使用异常处理。Because `input` must exactly conform to one of the formats specified in `formats`, you should always use exception handling when converting a string input by the user to a time interval. 如果不想使用异常处理，可以改为调用 方法。If you prefer not to use exception handling, you can call the method instead. `formats` 参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单个标准格式说明符，或者是一个或多个定义所需的 `input`格式的自定义格式说明符。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 Timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义的 timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必须完全与 `formats` 的成员相对应，以便分析操作成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 分析操作尝试将 `input` 与 `formats` 中的每个元素进行匹配，从数组中的第一个元素开始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 仅当用于分析 `input` 的格式字符串是标准的 格式字符串（其值为 "g" 或 "G"）时， 方法才能使用 `formatProvider` 参数指定的区域性约定。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t" 和 "T" 标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义输入字符串的精确格式，并使用原义字符分隔时间间隔的组成部分。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider` 参数是一个 实现，如果用于分析 `input` 的格式字符串是标准格式字符串，则它提供有关返回字符串格式的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下任一项：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示要在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 属性返回的 对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个 对象，该对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现 接口的自定义对象。A custom object that implements the interface. 它的 方法返回提供格式设置信息的 对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果 `null``formatProvider`，则使用与当前区域性关联的 对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例调用 方法，将字符串数组的每个元素转换为 值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 该示例使用法语（法国）区域性的格式设置约定来解释字符串。The example interprets the strings using the formatting conventions of the French - France ("fr-FR") culture. 这些字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规长格式的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，该示例还更改了时间间隔分析方法解释单个数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，单个数字被解释为时间间隔中的天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h` 自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 要使此更改生效，请注意，`%h` 自定义格式字符串必须位于 `formats` 数组中的其他格式字符串之前。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔的字符串表示形式，该时间间隔必须采用 `format` 参数定义的格式，但会忽略前导和尾随空白字符。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 由于 `input` 必须严格符合 `format` 的格式，因此，在将用户的字符串输入转换为时间间隔时，应始终使用异常处理。Because `input` must conform to the format of `format` exactly, you should always use exception handling when converting a string input by the user to a time interval. 如果不想使用异常处理，可以改为调用 方法。If you prefer not to use exception handling, you can call the method instead. `format` 参数是包含单个标准格式说明符的字符串，或一个或多个定义所需的 `input`格式的自定义格式说明符。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 Timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义的 timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). > [!IMPORTANT] > 仅当 `format` 是标准的 格式字符串（其值为 "g" 或 "G"）时， 方法才使用 `formatProvider` 参数指定的区域性约定。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if `format` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t" 和 "T" 标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义输入字符串的精确格式，并使用原义字符分隔时间间隔的组成部分。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider` 参数是一个 实现，如果 `format` 是标准格式字符串，则它提供有关返回字符串格式的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下任一项：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示要在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 属性返回的 对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个 对象，该对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现 接口的自定义对象。A custom object that implements the interface. 它的 方法返回提供格式设置信息的 对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果 `null``formatProvider`，则使用与当前区域性关联的 对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles` 参数会影响使用自定义格式字符串分析的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否仅当存在负号（）时将 `input` 解释为负时间间隔，或者是否始终解释为负时间间隔（）。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用 ，`format` 必须包含文本负号符号（如 "\\-"）才能成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法，使用各种格式字符串和区域性分析时间间隔的几个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. 它还使用 值将每个字符串解释为一个负时间间隔。It also uses the value to interpret each string as a negative time interval. 该示例的输出说明 样式仅在与自定义格式字符串一起使用时才影响返回值。The output from the example illustrates that the style affects the return value only when it is used with custom format strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔的字符串表示形式，该时间间隔必须采用 `formats` 参数定义的格式之一，但会忽略前导和尾随空白字符。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in one of the formats defined by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 由于 `input` 必须严格符合 `formats`中指定的格式之一，因此，在将用户的字符串输入转换为时间间隔时，应始终使用异常处理。Because `input` must exactly conform to one of the formats specified in `formats`, you should always use exception handling when converting a string input by the user to a time interval. 如果不想使用异常处理，可以改为调用 方法。If you prefer not to use exception handling, you can call the method instead. `formats` 参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单个标准格式说明符，或者是一个或多个定义所需的 `input`格式的自定义格式说明符。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 Timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义的 timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必须完全与 `formats` 的成员相对应，以便分析操作成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 分析操作尝试将 `input` 与 `formats` 中的每个元素进行匹配，从数组中的第一个元素开始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 仅当用于分析 `input` 的格式字符串是标准的 格式字符串（其值为 "g" 或 "G"）时， 方法才能使用 `formatProvider` 参数指定的区域性约定。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t" 和 "T" 标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义输入字符串的精确格式，并使用原义字符分隔时间间隔的组成部分。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider` 参数是一个 实现，如果用于分析 `input` 的格式字符串是标准格式字符串，则它提供有关返回字符串格式的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下任一项：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示要在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 属性返回的 对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个 对象，该对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现 接口的自定义对象。A custom object that implements the interface. 它的 方法返回提供格式设置信息的 对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果 `null``formatProvider`，则使用与当前区域性关联的 对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles` 参数会影响使用自定义格式字符串分析的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否仅当存在负号（）时将 `input` 解释为负时间间隔，或者是否始终解释为负时间间隔（）。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用 ，`format` 必须包含文本负号符号（如 "\\-"）才能成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例调用 方法，将字符串数组的每个元素转换为 值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 这些字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规长格式的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，该示例还更改了时间间隔分析方法解释单个数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，单个数字被解释为时间间隔中的天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h` 自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 要使此更改生效，请注意，`%h` 自定义格式字符串必须位于 `formats` 数组中的其他格式字符串之前。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. 另请注意，在方法调用中指定的 标志仅在使用此格式说明符分析字符串时使用。Also note from the output that the flag specified in the method call is used only when parsing a string with this format specifier. summary.span: 将当前 对象的值转换为其等效的字符串表示形式。

span.span: Converts the value of the current object to its equivalent string representation.

returns.span: 当前 值的字符串表示形式。

span.span: The string representation of the current value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回的字符串的格式为 "c" 格式说明符并采用以下格式：The returned string is formatted with the "c" format specifier and has the following format: [-][*d*.]*hh*:*mm*:*ss*[.*fffffff*][-][*d*.]*hh*:*mm*:*ss*[.*fffffff*] 方括号（[和]）中的元素不能包含在返回的字符串中。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) may not be included in the returned string. 冒号和句点（：和）是文本字符。Colons and periods (: and.) are literal characters. 下表列出了非文本元素。The non-literal elements are listed in the following table. 请注意， 方法返回的字符串不区分区域性。Note that the string returned by the method is not culture-sensitive. |项Item|说明Description| |----------|-----------------| |"-""-"|负号，指示负时间间隔。A minus sign, which indicates a negative time interval. 对于正时间跨度，不包含任何符号。No sign is included for a positive time span.| |"*d*""*d*"|时间间隔中的天数。The number of days in the time interval. 如果时间间隔小于一天，则省略此元素。This element is omitted if the time interval is less than one day.| |"*hh*""*hh*"|时间间隔中的小时数，范围为0到23。The number of hours in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 23.| |"*mm*""*mm*"|时间间隔中的分钟数，范围为0到59。The number of minutes in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 59.| |"*ss*""*ss*"|时间间隔中的秒数，范围介于0到59之间。The number of seconds in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 59.| |"*fffffff*""*fffffff*"|时间间隔中秒的小数部分。Fractional seconds in the time interval. 如果时间间隔不包含秒的小数部分，则省略此元素。This element is omitted if the time interval does not include fractional seconds. 如果存在，则始终使用七个十进制数字表示秒的小数部分。If present, fractional seconds are always expressed using seven decimal digits.| > [!NOTE] > 有关比较 和 Oracle 数据类型的字符串表示形式的详细信息，请参阅知识库文章[324577： system.web 不匹配 Oracle 9I INTERVAL DAY 到 SECOND 数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=161146)。For more information about comparing the string representation of and Oracle data types, see Knowledge Base article [324577: System.TimeSpan Does Not Match Oracle 9i INTERVAL DAY TO SECOND Data Type](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=161146). ## Examples 下面的示例显示了通过使用多个 值调用 方法返回的字符串。The following example displays the strings returned by calling the method with a number of values. 请注意，尽管该示例不会直接调用 方法，但在尝试将 值转换为其字符串表示形式时， 方法会调用它。Note that although the example does not call the method directly, it is called by the method when it attempts to convert a value to its string representation. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/cs/ToString1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/vb/ToString1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `format` 参数可以是任何有效的标准或自定义格式说明符用于 值。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard or custom format specifier for values. 如果 `format` 等于 或 `null`，则当前 对象的返回值将用通用格式说明符（"c"）进行格式设置。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the common format specifier ("c"). 如果 `format` 为任何其他值，则该方法将引发 。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . 如果 `format` 是标准格式字符串，则返回的字符串的格式由当前区域性的格式设置约定定义。If `format` is a standard format string, the format of the returned string is defined by the formatting conventions of the current culture. > [!IMPORTANT] > 用于 值的自定义格式字符串不包含日期或时间分隔符。The custom format strings for values do not include a date or time separator. 如果要在格式字符串中包含这些元素，则必须将它们视为字符文本。If you want to include these elements in your format string, you must treat them as character literals. 有关详细信息，请参阅示例，并查看[自定义的 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)主题。See the example for an illustration, and see the [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md) topic for more information. .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下格式设置主题更详细地介绍了这些支持：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关 值的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 Timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义的 timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about format strings for values, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). - 有关 .NET Framework 中的格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式设置类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). ## Examples 下面的示例使用标准的和自定义的 格式字符串来显示 值数组中每个元素的字符串表示形式。The following example uses standard and custom format strings to display the string representation of each element in an array of values [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/cs/tostring3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/vb/tostring3.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法与 方法类似，不同之处在于，如果转换失败，则它不会引发异常。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `s` 参数包含如下格式的时间间隔规范：The `s` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*][-]{ *d* | *d*。*hh*：*mm*[：*ss*[。*ff*]] | *hh*：*mm*[：*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | *d*.*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 需要使用括在大括号（{和}）中的替代项列表进行一项选择，|并用竖线（）分隔。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|说明Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选空白。Optional white space.| |-|可选的负号，指示负 。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|天，范围介于0到10675199之间。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |..|一种区分区域性的符号，用于将天与小时隔开。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 固定格式使用句点（"."）字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|小时，范围为0到23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |：:|区分区域性的时间分隔符。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 固定格式使用冒号（"："）字符。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分钟，范围为0到59。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|可选秒，范围介于0到59之间。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |..|区分区域性的符号，将秒与秒的小数部分分隔开来。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 固定格式使用句点（"."）字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|可选的秒的小数部分，由1到7个十进制数字组成。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| `s` 的组件必须共同指定一个大于或等于 且小于或等于 的时间间隔。The components of `s` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法尝试使用当前区域性的每个特定于区域性的格式来分析 `s`。The method tries to parse `s` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the current culture. ## 调用方说明Notes to callers 在某些情况下，当要分析的字符串中的时间间隔组件包含的位数超过7个时，.NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本中成功的分析操作可能会失败，并将在 .NET Framework 4 及更高版本中引发 。In some cases, when a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations that succeed in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the .NET Framework 4 and later versions. 下面的示例演示了这种情况。The following example illustrates this scenario. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/tryparsefailure1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/tryparsefailure1.vb#3)] ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法从有效的 字符串创建 对象，并指示当分析操作因时间跨度字符串无效而失败的时间。The following example uses the method to create objects from valid strings and to indicate when the parse operation has failed because the time span string is invalid. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/TryParse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/TryParse1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔的字符串表示形式，该时间间隔必须采用 `format` 参数定义的格式，但会忽略前导和尾随空白字符。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法类似于 方法，但如果转换失败，则它不会引发异常。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `format` 参数是包含单个标准格式说明符的字符串，或一个或多个定义所需的 `input`格式的自定义格式说明符。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 Timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义的 timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). > [!IMPORTANT] > 仅当 `format` 是标准的 格式字符串（其值为 "g" 或 "G"）时， 方法才使用 `formatProvider` 参数指定的区域性约定。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if `format` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t" 和 "T" 标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义输入字符串的精确格式，并使用原义字符分隔时间间隔的组成部分。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider` 参数是一个 实现，如果 `format` 是标准格式字符串，则它提供有关返回字符串格式的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下任一项：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示要在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 属性返回的 对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个 对象，该对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现 接口的自定义对象。A custom object that implements the interface. 它的 方法返回提供格式设置信息的 对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果 `null``formatProvider`，则使用与当前区域性关联的 对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法，使用各种格式字符串和区域性分析时间间隔的几个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔的字符串表示形式，该时间间隔必须采用 `formats` 参数所指定的格式字符串之一定义的格式，但会忽略前导和尾随空白字符。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by one of the format strings specified by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法类似于 方法，但如果转换失败，则它不会引发异常。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `formats` 参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单个标准格式说明符，或者是一个或多个定义所需的 `input`格式的自定义格式说明符。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 Timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义的 timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必须完全与 `formats` 的成员相对应，以便分析操作成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 分析操作尝试将 `input` 与 `formats` 中的每个元素进行匹配，从数组中的第一个元素开始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 仅当用于分析 `input` 的格式字符串是标准的 格式字符串（其值为 "g" 或 "G"）时， 方法才能使用 `formatProvider` 参数指定的区域性约定。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t" 和 "T" 标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义输入字符串的精确格式，并使用原义字符分隔时间间隔的组成部分。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider` 参数是一个 实现，如果用于分析 `input` 的格式字符串是标准格式字符串，则它提供有关返回字符串格式的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下任一项：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示要在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 属性返回的 对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个 对象，该对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现 接口的自定义对象。A custom object that implements the interface. 它的 方法返回提供格式设置信息的 对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果 `null``formatProvider`，则使用与当前区域性关联的 对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例调用 方法，将字符串数组的每个元素转换为 值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 该示例通过使用法语-法国（"fr"）区域性的格式设置约定来解释字符串。The example interprets the strings by using the formatting conventions of the French - France ("fr-FR") culture. 这些字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规长格式的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，该示例还更改了时间间隔分析方法解释单个数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，单个数字被解释为时间间隔中的天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h` 自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 要使此更改生效，请注意，`%h` 自定义格式字符串必须位于 `formats` 数组中的其他格式字符串之前。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔的字符串表示形式，该时间间隔必须采用 `formats` 参数所指定的格式字符串之一定义的格式，但会忽略前导和尾随空白字符。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by one of the format strings specified by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法类似于 方法，但如果转换失败，则它不会引发异常。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `formats` 参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单个标准格式说明符，或者是一个或多个定义所需的 `input`格式的自定义格式说明符。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 Timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)和[自定义的 timespan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必须完全与 `formats` 的成员相对应，以便分析操作成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 分析操作尝试将 `input` 与 `formats` 中的每个元素进行匹配，从数组中的第一个元素开始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 仅当用于分析 `input` 的格式字符串是标准的 格式字符串（其值为 "g" 或 "G"）时， 方法才能使用 `formatProvider` 参数指定的区域性约定。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t" 和 "T" 标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义输入字符串的精确格式，并使用原义字符分隔时间间隔的组成部分。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider` 参数是一个 实现，如果用于分析 `input` 的格式字符串是标准格式字符串，则它提供有关返回字符串格式的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下任一项：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示要在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 属性返回的 对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个 对象，该对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现 接口的自定义对象。A custom object that implements the interface. 它的 方法返回提供格式设置信息的 对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果 `null``formatProvider`，则使用与当前区域性关联的 对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles` 参数会影响使用自定义格式字符串分析的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否仅当存在负号（）时将 `input` 解释为负时间间隔，或者是否始终解释为负时间间隔（）。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用 ，`format` 必须包含文本负号符号（如 "\\-"）才能成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例调用 方法，将字符串数组的每个元素转换为 值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 这些字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规长格式的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，该示例还更改了时间间隔分析方法解释单个数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，单个数字被解释为时间间隔中的天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h` 自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 要使此更改生效，请注意，`%h` 自定义格式字符串必须位于 `formats` 数组中的其他格式字符串之前。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. 另请注意，在方法调用中指定的 标志仅在使用此格式说明符分析字符串时使用。Also note from the output that the flag specified in the method call is used only when parsing a string with this format specifier. remarks.format: ## Remarks 由于 字段的值是一个表示零时间值的 对象，因此可以将它与其他 对象进行比较，以确定后者是表示正、非零还是负时间间隔。Because the value of the field is a object that represents a zero time value, you can compare it with other objects to determine whether the latter represent positive, non-zero, or negative time intervals. 你还可以使用此字段将 对象初始化为零时间值。You can also use this field to initialize a object to a zero time value. ## Examples 下面的示例引用并显示 "" 字段的值。The following example references and displays the value of the field.
